intro: Androsace villosa var. zambalensis, commonly known as the Zambales cushion plant, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
